result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Bail/bond hearing on November 8, 2022 at 10:30 am.

8:39 AM Defendant Paul G Schmidt in court, in custody.  Attorney Justin G Griffis in court for Paul G Schmidt.  Attorney Jack A. Pitzo in court for State of Wisconsin. 

The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary. 
Waive reading of Information. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. 
Bail remains as fixed.
Hearing scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Motion for Bond Modification, filed by Attorney Griffis.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Waukesha County Jail Inmate Communication Form dated 10/12/2022 requesting a bail modification.
**Reviewed by Judge Dorow on 10/18/2022 - The defendant will need to work with his attorney to file a motion with the court.**
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on October 31, 2022 at 08:15 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Paul G Schmidt
Current: Waukesha Co Jail, 515 W Moreland Blvd, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 10-03-2022)
Prior: 507 High St, Pewaukee, WI 53072

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to use/possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 4 supervision.  The defendant is ordered to comply with CAM monitoring through WCS.  CAM duration pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM.  Defendant is not to enter any premises, other than a grocery store, that sells/serves alcohol beverages by the drink or into any liquor store. Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release.

3:51 PM Defendant Paul G Schmidt in court, in custody.  Attorney J Andrew Herbers Jr. in court for Paul G Schmidt. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe.
Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed. Preliminary Hearing requested. Preliminary time limits waived.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
